title: Lord Alaric Thornwood
atAGlance:
**Lord Alaric Thornwood** - Master of the Green Wood, "The Honest Lord"

- Rules the great western forestsâ€”timber, hunting, and practical folk
- Known as the one honest Lord in a court of schemers
- Says what he means, keeps his word, judges by actions not birth
- Produces the finest bows and archers in the Kingdom
- *Common saying: "A Thornwood promise is worth more than a Belmont contract."*

| | |
|---|---|
| **Age** | 42 |
| **Seat** | Thornwood Hall |
| **Region** | Western forests |
| **Allegiance** | Honor and his people |
| **Threat Level** | Low |

---
commonKnowledge:
### Appearance & Manner
Tall, rangy build of a woodsman. Weather-beaten face with laugh lines. Brown hair, green eyes. Simple dressâ€”quality but not showy. Calloused hands because he actually works. Moves like a hunter. Speaks directly, sometimes to his political detriment.

### Personality
Genuinely honestâ€”almost a disability at court. Values competence over birth. Uncomfortable with politics. Loyal friend, terrible enemy. Protective of his people and family. Prefers forests to castles. Keeps being surprised by political betrayals.

### Family
- **Wife:** Lady Marian (nÃ©e Valcourt, 40) - Lord Valcourt's sister. Marriage became genuine love. More politically aware than Alaric.
- **Heir:** Roland (20) - Honest like father, better at reading people. Capable ranger. Unmarried.
- **Second Son:** Garrett (17) - Different from fatherâ€”enjoys court games. Studies politics. Alaric doesn't know what to make of him.
- **Sisters:** Helena (married to Lord Ashfeld), Greta (married to Lord Wolfstein).

### Domain & Resources
Rules ~12,000 people in the ancient forests. Produces timber, famous Thornwood longbows, furs, and game. Commands 1,400 soldiers including 200 elite rangersâ€”best archers in the Kingdom. The forests themselves are natural defense.

### Political Position
Loosely part of the Military Bloc through family connections (Greta married to Wolfstein). Friendly with the crown but not politically active. Other Lords respect his honesty even when they can't understand it.

---
secretKnowledge:
### True Nature
Alaric is genuinely what he appearsâ€”honest, honorable, and uncomfortable with the games other Lords play. But he has secrets even his family doesn't know. His ideology is softer than most Lords, and he's quietly done things that would scandalize the Kingdom.

### The Veraheim Sympathy
Alaric doesn't fully embrace human supremacy:
- Respects what Vera Wyrdweaver built
- Has quietly helped refugees reach Veraheim
- Doesn't hate non-humans the way other Lords do
- Keeps this VERY quiet

If this were known, his reputation and position would be destroyed.

### The Timber Trade Secret
Thornwood timber is exported through Veraheim's tunnel:
- Ends up in the Broken Isles
- Becomes pirate ships
- Alaric knows (though he pretends not to)
- The gold is good, and he doesn't actually mind

This could be considered treasonâ€”trading with pirates through the neutral city.

### Garrett's Concerning Development
The second son is learning politics:
- Has been meeting with... people
- Learning the game his father despises
- Might be exactly what the family needs
- Or might become something Alaric would hate
- Has been approached by Blackthorne agents (hasn't committed)

### The Accidental Alliance Network
Through his sisters' marriages, Alaric is connected to:
- **Wolfstein** (Greta) - Military power
- **Ashfeld** (Helena) - Eastern frontier
- **Valcourt** (wife Marian) - Trade networks
- **Eisenwald** (through Wolfstein) - Iron production

This network could be powerful if activated. Alaric has never tried.

### What He Wants
- His domain peaceful and prosperous
- His family happy and safe
- To be left alone by court politics
- His values passed to his children

### What He Fears
- Being forced to compromise his principles
- His family used as political pawns
- The Kingdom's corruption spreading to his domain
- His secrets being exposed

### Story Hooks

| Hook | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **The Honest Broker** | Alaric is asked to mediate a Lord dispute. His honesty is valuableâ€”but someone wants him to fail. |
| **The Timber Trail** | Evidence of Thornwood timber on pirate ships. Cover-up or face the consequences? |
| **The Good Lord** | Refugees fleeing to Veraheim pass through Thornwood. Does Alaric help them openly? |
| **Garrett's Choice** | The second son has been offered something by Blackthorne. Does he take it? |
| **The Network Awakens** | Crisis requires Alaric to leverage his family connections. Can he play politics without becoming what he hates? |
